WRITING.TITLE: Illusion of Gaia, a Forgotten Gem, Was My Childhood
WRITING.TEXT: When I was a kid, my family wasn't the most well off in the world, but my parents both worked their asses off to make sure my sister and I had happy childhoods. I got my SNES near the end of it's lifespan, and with it, a little game called "Illusion of Gaia". Before I played this game, I had no idea that video games could have stories beyond "Go from left to right, and save the princess". But this game, while it had a few translation errors that created plotholes, blew my 10 year old mind. It had everything I had seen in the movies and read in books: Action, adventure, relatable characters, a story that I wanted to see to it's end, young romance, etc. Hell, this was the first video game that legit made me cry, and that was when gt;!Hamlet, the sweet little pig! lt; died. This is the game. This is when I truly became a gamer, and could appreciate the medium as an art form. Hell, this was the first game I ever streamed on Twitch, and put up on YouTube. If you want to watch it, I'll link to it, but, honestly, I think you should play it yourself. If you're a fan of SNES RPGs, then it's an experience that you don't want to rob yourself of. It's truly meant to be played, not watched. [My LP of Illusion of Gaia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5Qgj3ae-_0)
Hey, it's me!
There's a pizza in that picture?
Hello!

WRITING.TEXT: Hi guys! I'm a Let's Player, so my content doesn't really change with the seasons unless it's a themed game or something like that. I mostly stick to older games, though sometimes I venture out a bit. I just started a playthrough of Terranigma, an old Super Nintendo RPG. [Here's Episode 1](https://youtu.be/6sffGMf7x6k) Thanks for your time!

WRITING.TITLE: Basically, here's what happened to Tik Tok.

WRITING.TEXT: If you seriously think that Twitch hasn't had a Switch app at the ready for a long time just waiting for the go ahead from Nintendo, I don't know what to tell you. Why would they deny themselves easy revenue? I assure you the problem lies on the Nintendo side. Hell, Switch still doesn't have a Netflix app. Do you think it's because Netflix doesn't feel like making one?

Because I remember back when Nintendo would copyright strike anything with gameplay footage on YouTube, and they were dragged kicking and screaming into the Let's Play era on YouTube. This seems like the same idea. If they can't control the stream, they won't facilitate it.

1) YouTube is owned by Google. Nintendo isn't going to do anything to piss off Google. 2) Hulu is owned by Disney. Nintendo isn't going to do anything to piss off Disney. 3) Nintendo is notoriously stingy when it comes to gameplay footage.

That makes sense, guess I'm buying that Elgato then lol Thank you for sending me a measured response that neither insulted me nor assumed negative motives. Man, I make one joke about Nintendo hating me and all the simps come riding in.
Got a decent answer. No need for more responses.
Which is why i picked Clorox wipes as my VPI. No one else is even close right now lol

WRITING.TITLE: Problems with attacking
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys, for some reason, when I try to attack an enemy, it defaults to "Medium range attack". Like, I'll click on an enemy, and all my guys will back up, and only the ones with medium range weapons will fire. is there any fix to this? #8203;
